feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Business Application Studio
feed.subtitle: SAP Business Application Studio Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP BAS Cloud Foundry Login Error: Authentication failed. Please try again
entry.content:
At times we get into a situation where things seems to be strange. I would like to share one of such situation with respect to SAP BTP Business Application Studio(BAS) login to Cloud Foundry(CF) for one of the subaccount API endpoint.

Error Authentication failed. Please try again

First thing is to validate if you are using right:

  1. Cloud Foundry API endpoint
  2. Credentials or SSO
  3. Authentication method: 1) Credentials 2) SSO. If SSO then do verify either with a) Default identity provider or b) Alternate identity provider( configured by your enterprise)

If all above are all verified then do check Dev Space on BAS is running out of memory. I did create a new Dev space and CF login was resolved. 

There is a SAP note # 3533620 CF CLI in SAP Business Application Studio fails with error
"Error read/writing config: invalid character '\x00' looking for beginning of value" , however did not try it out.

entry.title: Unified Destination Setup for Accessing Multiple OData Services in BAS
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

I would like to ask a question regarding how to manage Destinations on SAP BTP.

So far, we have been using the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility service to create Destinations for each individual communication scenario (e.g., one for sales order integration, another for purchase order integration).
As a result, we are ending up with multiple Destinations—one per communication scenario—that correspond to each OData service we wish to use.

On the other hand, when connecting BTP with an SAP on-premise system, it has been possible to access various OData services through a single Destination.

Our current objective is to enable a development flow where we can build a Fiori application in BAS and, at the initial data source selection step, choose from various OData services (e.g., purchase, sales, or custom OData) via a single Destination.

However, as it stands, only the OData services associated with the specific communication scenario used when the Destination was created are selectable during BAS development. This limits flexibility in application development.

Is there any recommended configuration or best practice that would allow us to create a single Destination that can be used to access multiple communication scenarios or OData services?

I would greatly appreciate your guidance on this matter.

Thanks,

entry.title: The ‘Field is Required’ validation message is not appearing on the Add Notification screen.
entry.content:
I’m working on the Add Notification screen in SAP Asset Manager 2405, and I have made several fields mandatory using the RequiredFields.js rule.

The validation is working correctly — the transaction does not proceed when the field is empty — however, the “Field is Required” message is not displayed on the UI for the following control:

  • FuncLocHierarchyExtensionControl

Other required fields (such as Work Center and Reported By) show the required message correctly, but this extension control does not.

I have verified the following:

  • IsRequired = true is correctly set in the metadata.

  • The control name matches the ID added in RequiredFields.js.

  • The CheckRequiredFields action is triggered during Save.

  • The ValidationRule (NotificationCreateUpdateValidation.js) is executed.

Despite this, only the validation logic works—the required field message does not appear on the UI for this FormCell.Extension control.

 

Could you please help me understand why the “Field is Required” message does not appear for FormCell.Extension (HierarchyExtension) controls and whether there is any additional configuration or workaround required to make this work?

entry.title: How to clone a CAP based solution from one HANA Cloud Database to another?
entry.content:
Hello experts,

If you wanted to copy a CAP based solution between environments (e.g. PROD -> TEST) how would you do it?

Let's say you have a CAP based solution running productively and you want to clone that system into a test system. This solution is a stack consisting of 1+ CAP servers instances hosted in Cloud foundry and connected to a SAP HANA Cloud instance. Production and test are completely separate (Different HANA Cloud DBs).

Suppose both the production and test systems already exist and are working, they just have different data. We'd like to wipe the test system and repopulate it with data from the production system.

How do you typically do this? Specifically I'm looking for recommended procedures on how to do this please?

Options

One way that will work is using DB Explorer to export all the data for all the tables and then on the test DB import those files. The problem with this approach is it will require quite a lot of manual clicking, time and possibly slicing of data since it is not possible to export some tables in one go (as they are too large).

DB explorer also has an option for exporting catalog objects, but if I understand correctly, these exports bring data as well as all the scripts to create such objects on a target DB. If they were imported they would create a completely new schema/HDI on the target DB. If this is the case this is definitely not what we want.

Is there any other approach, please?
Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Connection error to CAP MCP servers in BAS with Cline
entry.content:
Hi there

I've attended AD160 hands-on session at TechEd in Berlin which didn't work out too well due to technical issues... meh.

So I tried to play around with the CAP MCP and the Cline extension for ourselves. For that we set up a brand new subaccount with SAB Build Code and AI Core (boosters). But we're facing some issues. What we did and what works so far:

- added Cline extension ✅
- installed npm packages gobally (@cap-js/mcp-server, @SAP-ux/fiori-mcp-server, @ui5/mcp-server) ✅
- connected Cline with SAP AI Core (same subaccount) ✅
- set global rule (with this and this) ✅

But what doesn't work at all is the connection to the MCP servers from Cline. I have this configuration but Cline says "MCP error -32000: Connection closed" ⛔

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "disabled": false,
      "timeout": 60,
      "type": "stdio",
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server@latest"],
      "env": {}
    }
  }
}

When I set up the exact same in VS Code locally (with connection to SAP AI Core) it works quite well. Any ideas what the problem could be?

entry.title: Sync Fails on Manually Created Mobile Service, but Works on Auto-Created Service (SSAM 2505)
entry.content:
I am facing a syncing issue in my SAP MDK 2505 application, and I need help understanding why it behaves differently based on how the Mobile Service is created.

I have two Mobile Services:

  • Manually created Mobile Service (created directly in SAP Mobile Services cockpit)
  • Automatically created Mobile Service (generated through the backend using the Config Panel)

When I deploy my MDK 2505 application to:

  • Manually created mobile service - Sync fails
  • Auto-created mobile service - Sync works perfectly

The same app bundle, same user, same backend, and same device are used in both tests.

I verified that the App ID, App Version, roles, security settings, and Offline OData destination are identical, and I also recreated and redeployed multiple times.


My question is: why does syncing work only with the backend-generated Mobile Service but not with the manually created one? Does the auto-created service contain additional metadata or offline configuration that is not visible in the cockpit, or are there required settings in the manual service is missing?
Any guidance or checklist explaining the differences between manual and backend-created Mobile Services for offline sync would be helpful.

entry.title: Unsupported OData Version 4.01 when connecting Fiori List Report app to Sales Order API
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I’m currently working on a specific development in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.
we are developing a Fiori app that allows users to mass change sales order items (quantity, delivery date, add new items, etc.).

For this purpose, we are using SAP Business Application Studio.
We first created a List Report application, then connected it to an OData service using the following API:
https://myxxxxxx-api.s4hana.cloud.sap/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_salesorder/srvd_a2x/sap/salesorder/0001/

However, when running the application, we receive the following error message:

“Could not open app. Please try again later. Details”

 

Could you please help me understand this behavior and guide us on how to resolve this issue?

entry.title: How to use BTP destination with OAuth2ClientCredentials in BAS Fiori app
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have created a destination in BTP Cloud Foundry as below.

Then I create a Fiori app (Freestyle, Basic template) in BAS and choose "Add Application to Managed Application Router" in the project template.  And I have added the following highlighted part to xs-app.json file.

And add the following in ui5.yaml file. 

Other template-generated files are unchanged, like "xs-security.json". So if I use the following code to call the API endpoint via the destination, I got err "Invalid access token".

It seems that the destination doesn't auto request the access token with the configured client_id and secret. I can see other project in the same subaccount is using a CAP service to get the destination's token_url, client_id and secrete to manually request the token. Is this kind of CAP manual approach is unavoidable? can we just make the destination service to auto get the access token when redirect the API call? Please help advise. Any tips will be much appreciated.

Thanks,

Rayman

entry.title: Redirect navigation to extended “Manage Central Purchase Contracts” app
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good day.

We are facing a peculiar situation and I would like to know if anyone has any ideas on how we could resolve it.

We created an extension of the standard Manage Central Purchase Contracts app. The change was developed in SAP BAS, and the deployment was successful. We also created a target mapping and a tile to use the new extended app. Up to this point, everything works fine, and all tests ran successfully.Target Mapping Inbound Navigation

However, we encountered another issue.

We noticed that a user is working with the Process Purchase Requisitions Centrally app, which includes an option to open the Manage Central Purchase Contracts app. What we need is for this navigation to open our extended app instead of the original standard one.

The problem is that we don’t know how to achieve this.
Do we need to extend the Process Purchase Requisitions Centrally app as well?
Or is there any way to adjust the target mapping or redirect the navigation without modifying that app?

We are honestly a bit lost on how this could be done, and any guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks
EBZ

entry.title: How to Consume SCIM 2.0 API from SAPUI5 Application in SAP Business Application Studio?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am trying to integrate a SCIM 2.0 API (Users endpoint) into an existing SAPUI5 application running in SAP Business Application Studio. I have already configured an HTTP destination in my BTP subaccount with Basic Authentication.
However, when I try to consume this destination from the SAPUI5 app during local preview (using Fiori Tools), I repeatedly get the error: “service-destination: missing required property: type”
The BAS preview runtime does not seem to recognize or bind the destination.
I also attempted to define the destination inside xs-app.json and route /scim/ paths to the destination, but BAS still does not pick it up. Since this is a standalone SAPUI5 application, there is no runConfigurations folder or approuter module, just an xs-app.json.
Additionally, direct AJAX calls to the SCIM endpoint fail due to CORS and server-side authentication restrictions.

My question is:
Is there any supported approach to call SCIM 2.0 APIs directly from a SAPUI5 application in BAS?
If there is a way to make the destination available during local preview for standalone SAPUI5 apps, please guide me on the correct configuration.
Any insights, best practices, or examples would be greatly appreciated.
#SCIM #SCIMAPI #SAPUI5

entry.title: SCIM 2.0 API – 404 Not Found when creating user in IAS via UI5 proxy (local BAS preview)
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am trying to create a user in SAP Identity Authentication Service (IAS) using the SCIM API (POST /Users). I followed the documentation from API Hub(SAP Business Accelerator Hub) and set up my local UI5 proxy, but I keep getting a 404 Not Found error. Below are the details: 


My Configuration
ui5.yaml snippet:

Issue
-When I run locally and call http://localhost:8080/scim/Users, I get 404 Not Found.
-Direct API call (https://<tenant-subdomain>.accounts.ondemand.com/scim/Users) with token works fine.
-Seems like the proxy mapping is not resolving correctly.

My Question

1)Is my ui5.yaml proxy configuration correct for forwarding /scim/Users requests?
2)Do I need to adjust the path or mountPath to include /Users explicitly?
3)Any best practices for testing SCIM API locally with UI5 proxy?

please guide me on the correct configuration.
Any insights, best practices, or examples would be greatly appreciated.
#SCIM #SCIMAPI #SAPUI5

entry.title: sap-btp-free-tier-access-issue
entry.content:
I’m reaching out to the SAP Community for help, as I’m currently blocked in my SAP BTP learning journey. I’m facing issues like the DCPP_017 error, difficulty enabling the Free Tier with my university email, and BAS access denied. If anyone has faced similar problems or knows a workaround, your support would mean a lot. Kindly take a moment to review the issue summary I’ve included below. Thank you!

Issue Summary

Issue 1: BAS Access Denied in Trial Account

When navigating: SAP BTP Cockpit → Services → Instances and Subscriptions → SAP Business Application Studio

I receive the following error:

Access Denied
You do not have the necessary roles to access SAP Business Application Studio.

 

Multiple SAP community posts suggest that Business Application studio access is restricted in Trial, and that switching to Free Tier resolves the problem.

What I Tried Next — SAP Free Tier Setup

I followed SAP’s official page: Get an Account on SAP BTP to Try Out Free Tier Service Plans

But two new issues appeared:

Issue 2: Personal Email Not Allowed for Free Tier

When attempting to convert/join Free Tier:

To access SAP Free Tier, personal email domains are not allowed.
Please use a company or university email.

I used my University email (even though I already graduated).

Issue 3: Account Creation Failure (DCPP_017 Error)

After entering the required details using my university email, the process fails with:

 

I retried several times—same error.

Support Ticket

I raised a support request through the SAP community. It has been 3 days with no response yet.

Request for Community Help

If anyone has:

1. Faced similar errors

2. Solved DCPP_017

3. Successfully enabled Free Tier using university email

4. Has insights into BAS access limitations

Your guidance will truly help me continue my SAP learning journey.

Thank you in advance!

- Vineeth

entry.title: CAP Deployment Stuck on "deploy-to-postgresql" – GCP Subaccount (Frankfurt)
entry.content:
Hello CAP developers,

Since yesterday, I’ve been unable to deploy a CAP application using PostgreSQL on SAP BTP. The deployment hangs at this step:

Executing task "deploy-to-postgresql" on application "name-of-app"

(Attached screenshot)

After this, the database doesn’t seem to work, and all CAP service calls fail.

Environment details:

  • Deployment method: cf deploy
  • Node.js: 20.19.3
  • npm: 11.4.1
  • CAP dependencies:
    "@cap-js-community/odata-v2-adapter": "^1.15.7",
"@cap-js/postgres": "^2.1.0",
"@sap-cloud-sdk/connectivity": "^4.0.2",
"@sap-cloud-sdk/http-client": "^4.0.2",
"@sap/cds": "^9.5.1",
"@sap/eslint-plugin-cds": "^3.1.2",
"dayjs": "^1.11.13"
  • Dev dependencies:
    "@cap-js/cds-types": "^0.15.0",
"@cap-js/sqlite": "^2.0.1",
"@sap/cds-dk": "^9.5.0"
  • PostgreSQL setup: via SAP BTP
  • Subaccount provider: GCP (Google Cloud)
  • Region: Europe (Frankfurt)
  • Recent changes: None
  • Logs: No errors shown
  • Service bindings: PostgreSQL service instance is correctly bound to the app

entry.title: CSV Validation before uploading data to Data file load in SAP Marketing cloud
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We on a regular basis uploading contacts data using CSV into Data file load application and it consumes lot of time as we have to correct each and every error during validation step and again during upload we get new errors.

So, fixing all the errors and uploading data consumes lot of man hours and we want to validate the CSV file before uploading to SAP Marketing cloud and I want to get your ideas of validating this data using AI prompts or using any method which will reduce the time taken to correct errors multiple time during data file upload.

Can we achieve it using SAP Build Apps , joule with no code low code or do we have any better way to achieve this specifically for SAP Marketing cloud files.

Thanks for your inputs.

Regards,
Saravana

entry.title: Connection BAS to TRL instance (Abap trial), Cloud Trial Cockpit environment
entry.content:
Hello

I´m trying to connect BAS to the TRL instance (Abap in cloud trial cockpit environment) and it´s not possible due to error message:
"Authentication incorrect. Please check the SAP BTP destination authentication configuration."

I´m following the indications in:
https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-blog-posts/end-to-end-guide-to-consume-rap-application-to-fiori-using-sap-business/ba-p/13945033

Previosly this method has worked for me without any trouble but, since the trial expires each 3 months, I have to repeat it now.
I can get connected correctly to Abap TRL and I can run correctly BAS from cloud trial cockpit but I can´t connect BAS to Abap TRL to read the backend services.

Any idea? , has it changed the procedure?

I have checked this other procedure

https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/abap-custom-ui-bas-connect-s4hc.html#4b2d6666-e392-440a-b639-3ff4edfe27d6

but in the one hand I´m not sure if it applies to the Cloud Trial Cokpit and in the other I don´t understand some points, for instance:

- "In the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, navigate to the Communication Systems app"  , where is it in the trial cockpit (or in TRL)  this app?, I don´t see anything similar

-  Where is this "YOUR_SYSTEMS_ID" , maybe is the one in "Communication Systems app"

Name<YOUR_SYSTEMS_ID>_SAML_ASSERTION 

Thanks

entry.title: Very Small Click Area for Hierarchy Extension Navigation in SAP Service & Asset Manager 2405
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are facing an issue in SAP Service & Asset Manager 2405, using the standard iOS client downloaded from the App Store.

In the Hierarchy Extension views, when we click on the expand/collapse or child-navigation icon, the touch area is extremely small. If the user does not tap exactly on that tiny icon, the app opens the details screen of the list item instead of navigating to the child hierarchy.

This creates usability issues because the correct tap zone is too small on iOS.

Is there any way to increase the clickable/touch area of the hierarchy icon in MDK?

We are using:

   SAP Service & Asset Manager 2405

    iOS device

   Standard client (no custom client)

Please see the attached screen.png file

Best Regards,

Divan Wellalage
